Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Good service.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a little problem with the towels. But the service was good and they gave us another room as an apology

Reviews.Title: “A good Hotel, although not a four star rating”
Reviews.Author: Justin C
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Hotel, to be greeted by a rather rude and unfriendly receptionist. This attitude seem to be the same with the majority of staff I came across. The Room was large and clean, but with a dirty carpet, an old T.V and a bed so low I thought I was sleeping on the floor. The swimming pool was the big selling point. Very nice and relaxing. But I was met by the swimming pool attendant, who shouted at me for eating an apple near to the pool side. Although, it was fine for her to eat her lunch every day, and let the customers she liked smoke. Excellent shopping centre, bars and restaurants nearby. I would return again.

Reviews.Title: “convenient for the airport and metro”
Reviews.Author: LauraFlannery
Reviews.Content: A very strange set up, lots of little chalet style rooms, we stayed in the hotel section at the back, the door handles are metal and the 34degree sun was directly on them, so the first touch was an experience ow! we checked in at 5pm and our rooms were still not ready, no tea and cofee in the rooms. Lovely swimming pool and garden area to relax in, but i can't imagine why anyone would stay more than a couple of nights there, we booked as it was close to the airport and luckinly the metro was fairly close so only 20 mins into central Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Night's Stay”
Reviews.Author: janetgool
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed here for one night while en route between Israel and Miami. He was very pleased with the room, which was large, comfortable and clean. His only complaint was about the night clerk, who insisted that the shuttle could only meet him at Terminal Two. The next day a more flexible clerk arranged for the shuttle to return him to Terminal Four.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of No Where”
Reviews.Author: expatinespana
Reviews.Content: Strange property, kinda like an American motel. Its really in the middle of suburban no where. It is close to the airport but I waited an hour for the shuttle to arrive at the air port and I had to call 3 times. The subway into Madrid is about a 10 minute walk , not really far but you have to cross over the interstate. The room was okay, not fancy but large and clean. When I was leaving , I asked about the shuttle to the airport the next morning and was told I needed to be in the lobby 45 mins before the time I wanted to arrive a the airport, But it was only a 10 min ride there so I was very early.

Reviews.Title: “very satisfactory--but not a 3.5 star in my book”
Reviews.Author: jabrase
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here, while the room was adequate, it is a real stretch to see a 3.5 star rating. I'd give it a 2 at the very best--it is in need of paint and some upkeep and updating. The room was clean and the front desk people helpful. However, the one big plus was the very nice and quite new van that will take you to the airport at your convenience, 24 hours a day--and it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad except for the staff”
Reviews.Author: Susyna91
Reviews.Content: We went there past July for 3 days. The location allows you to easily visit the city, in fact you can walk to the metro station. The swimming pool is good to relax after a day walking around Madrid. Now come the negative notes: We were put in a room for disables where the shower was located approximately at 1.20 m from the floor (which made it very difficult to was standing up). Not to mention the staff that was extremely rude and not very helpfull!!

Reviews.Title: “Good find, if you're near IFEMA”
Reviews.Author: Binu P
Reviews.Content: It did not look like a hotel, but more like a resort. But that's the looks. It was more of a motel, but a good one. Rooms are spacious, washrooms are good. The mini bar is well stocked. Breakfast is superb. Great selection of teas, breads, fruits and meat. Nice staff at the front desk. For those who think its far off from the city, then taxi costs just 15 or 18 from Sol. And less than 20 minutes. The Metro Station Canillejas on the Olive Green line is about 10 minutes' walk and about 30 minutes to Sol. The Cafe at the lobby is a great place to sit and relax with a nice but small selection of beverages and short eats. Taking into consideration its proximity to the airport, and not that far from the centre of the city, with spacious rooms and a good breakfast selection, the price is very reasonable. The only thing where one should not trust is, the shuttle service! Its basically name sake. Seats just about 7 people (i don't know why they have such a huge vehicle for that). And it moves only when full. Great place. Would love to go back there!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel for a fair price.”
Reviews.Author: EdVanL
Reviews.Content: Rooms are tidy. Beds are a bit hard. Rooms contain locker, minibar. Be aware that not all rooms are non-smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre one. Didn't Like at all. From a Four stars hotel i'm usually getting much much more!”
Reviews.Author: masterpix66
Reviews.Content: It looks Like a Very old stile hotel, to get to tour room you need to walk outside (better of it dosn't rain, as at the reception they do not grave umbrellas). Room is a tuo stars hotel room. Bed is also Very old and extremely noisy. Restaurant and breakfast as also no more than 3 stars category. If you do not get anything from minibar, in the invoice you'll find a Line saying "minibar" 1 EUR. They don't worry this is a city tax!!

Reviews.Title: “nice, affordable ,free shuttle”
Reviews.Author: JonsTravels11
Reviews.Content: Shuttle took along time , called the hotel twice to send it. unfriendly staff, slow checkin. Nice room, quite neighborhood. quite a walk to subway, front dest directions were awful. price was good, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not for senior citizens!”
Reviews.Author: travelerww
Reviews.Content: One must call hotel from airport to arrange pick up. Van arrived at T4 in about 25 minutes and then 20 minutes to the hotel which is located in a residential area. The hotel has seen better days and has an unique layout : two story town home like buildings which face a patio/pool area. Located by outside walkway via hotel driveway. Problem was we were assigned the upper room which required us to climb a 16 step steep rusted metal staircase with two 40lb suitcases! Door to room was made of thin steel. After returning to the front desk to complain, I was told a ground floor room "had just become available" & went to see it. The room was much smaller & much darker so we stayed in the upstairs room. Room was spacious & clean and the a/c worked well. Water temperature & pressure was fine. There is a small old TV & refrigerator. Pay WiFi is available and can be purchased at the front desk. There is a Corte Ingles department store/supermarket about a 10 minute walk away. Return to the airport's T1 terminal took less than 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Tale of two rooms”
Reviews.Author: DGlass
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Osuna twice on one trip -- for two nights upon arriving in Madrid, then for the last two nights of our trip prior to flying out of Madrid. Upon arrival at the airport, we were unable to figure out how to call the hotel shuttle to come pick us up - so we ended up taking a cab, which was 15 euro for a 10 minute trip. They gave us a bed in room #5, an upper room in the little "casita-style" houses they show on their website. The room was in pretty poor condition for a 4-story hotel. The bed was the hardest I've ever slept on, the air conditioning did not work well, and the room, overall, was very dated. It needed a big upgrade. I did not sleep well those nights. We had requested a king size bed, but ended up with two smaller beds, which was okay because we just pushed the two beds together. After reading the other reviews, I had expected the hotel staff to be disinterested, but found them to be fine -- friendly even. The pool area was very nice, the breakfast was really excellent. The walk to the metro was about 10-15 minutes, followed by a 20 minute ride do the center of Madrid (Sol). Then, upon returning to Madrid after visiting Valencia, we were given a different room, room 103, which was in the main building at the end of a pretty walkway - past all the little casita-style rooms. This room was much better. The room looked cleaner, with a much better bathroom. The air conditioner worked very well, the bed was softer. We were much more satisfied with this room. The pool and breakfast were, once again, excellent, and the staff was even friendlier the second time. The shuttle ride to the airport was easy and quick, and the driver was very friendly. I think that with a little upgrading, the hotel would really shine. They seem to need to replace their beds. All in all, I would recommend this hotel if you do not need or want to be in the center of Madrid -- it comes with a good price, good pool, great breakfast, and shuttle service which will, at least, work one way.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: edededed
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel to end our trip to Spain. Unfortunately we did not read the reviews. The staff was unhelpful and blatantly ignored us even when we were standing there asking a question at the desk, alone. The wifi was expensive and advertised free. We waited 45 minutes for the shuttle to arrive. And the next day I was riddled with bedbug bites. DO NOT STAY HERE. EVER.

Reviews.Title: “Very strongly advise against booking here”
Reviews.Author: Wheattinker
Reviews.Content: This hotel did not get it's 4 star rating based on customer service. From the front end reception to the room cleaning & maintenance, right through to the shuttle driver loudly playing his personal CD's, this hotel's management is in need of attention to guest service skills. Unfortunately, the quality of our hotel room was even worse than the guest service. Though there may be better rooms somewhere within the complex, this is definitely not a 4 star property throughout, but more like a 2 star motor lodge, with room doors opening onto the the parking laneway. Our room, in particular, should have been removed from the hotel's inventory due to serious water damage that caused mold, mildew & a lifting and twisting of the laminate flooring to the point where there was a gap under the exterior door. The supplies were lacking (no soap, missing bath towel), there was dried urine on the toilet seat, hair in the sink, & a used, dirty bath mat. In the morning, we had a visit from a spider. And cold water showers. The logical question would be why didn't we demand a different room? The reason: We'd already received an un-welcoming reception upon arrival, including staff inability to find our reservation, even though I had phoned by 6:00PM to say we would be arriving later. When we returned to the front desk after seeing the room, it was evident that the harried staff were busy dealing with several other guests' complaints...none of whom seemed to be receiving satisfaction. Ultimately, we were in the age-old traveller's predicament of needing a place for the night before an early morning flight. Upon check-out, I had to insisted to the non-English speaking front desk clerk on having the "Complaint Book". I documented the main complaints with a promise that the hotel management will be contacted. And they will be, following this warning to other travellers. So long as the expectation is a 4 star experience at the Osuna, there will be disappointment. Thus, the staff of this hotel will continue to be barraged with everyone's complaints, contributing to their bad attitude & lack of pride in their hotel. Do not book the Osuna unless your expectations are lower than a 4-star, and you are prepared to gamble that your room may or may not be tolerable.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Angelique19
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Osuna hotel with clients in June 2010 for a conference nearby. The only good thing i have to say about osuna is the proximity to the conference centre (which was only 15mins away on foot). Being a supposedly 4 star hotel, i at least thought the reception staff would know how to speak basic english....but NO. Thank God i knew some basic spanish, otherwise my clients would have ended up not knowing what hit them. The breakfast was nothing special, but that didn't bother us as much. The pool was half empty and not clean.....in June, a nice dip would have helped refresh ourselves. In the evening, the bar will switch off the lights and the staf will leave around midnight, regardless of customers still sitting down enjoying their drink. The rooms have very thin walls and every door opening and closing will sound so close you'd think it was your own door. The decor is way past being tired....please do some refurbishment! Unless you're stuck and there's no other hotel available, i wouldn't go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Atlas53
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind saving money by being a 10 minute walk from the underground, then another 10 minutes to the centre of the city, then this may be a great base for your visit to Madrid. The rooms are clean and well appointed...we even had shaving kits and combs included with the obligatory soap and shampoo...but we found the beds to be on the hard side. We stayed twice, 4nights and one night respectively, on either end of our Spanish vacation, and have he same comments for both rooms. The pool looked lovely, even though, in December, it was closed, and the grounds were well tended, with a small playground for the children. There is a free and quick 24/7 shuttle to and from the nearby airport, which we used four times, twice at 4.30 in the morning. But the real attraction to this hotel is the breakfast buffet! If you are staying a minimum of 2 nights the buffet is free, and it is a spread worth the price of the room! Our double room was less than 60 Euros a night, which we felt was a bargain, especially with the free shuttle and the incredible breakfast. For the days we traveled into the city I would have preferred to have a room nearby, just for convenience, but for value I don't think we could have done better than Osuna Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to the Baraja Airport”
Reviews.Author: snooka76
Reviews.Content: The Osuna Hotel is a good choice if you are planning a 1-2 day stopover in Madrid. It is located a few kilometers from the Baraja Airport and has cost-free taxi service from it. Rooms are very cosy and have comfortable beds. Bathrooms are clean and have towels, soap, shampoo and shower gel. The hotel has its own swimming pool. The price for double-room in October 2010 was 58 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fine - Staff Not So Helpful”
Reviews.Author: domrepman
Reviews.Content: I travelled from the UK with my son as it was his 21st birthday and I though I would treat him to watching Real Madrid play. We arrived late at night around 10pm as our flight was delayed from London. When I got to reception the receptionist told that the room was outside the reception to the left. After searching for about five minutes trying to find our room I went back to reception and asked to be shown the room. She actually refused and asked me (not rudely) to find it myself. I would have thought that at a hotel that cost us over 400 Euros for two nights stay the least I would get is someone to show us to our rooms. On getting to the rooms I found them to be comfortable apart from the bed which I found was hard. The room had a well stocked mini bar and the bathroom facilities were fine. Having to pay to access the internet on my own laptop is something that I think should be free in all hotels and it was expensive here.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars? No way!”
Reviews.Author: penunes
Reviews.Content: The room looked old and dirty. Torn bedcovers, huge stains on the carpet and a moldy smell. It was quite cold, and the bed had only sheets. Found a couple of ratty looking blankets in the wardrobe and had to use them. The bed was the most uncomfortable I've ever slept in. Old spring mattress, unstable, uncomfortable and made loud squeaking noises every time I moved. I had no help with my luggage, and the room was far from the reception (across the yard and with some stairs). There is no room service. Food in the restaurante is VERY expensive (15€ for breakfast). The walls are very thin and I could hear everything from the next door rooms and from above. So basically I was in a cold, noisy, dirty and uncomfortable room. Where I come from, this hotel would get 2 stars, not 4!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AT ALL COST ! MUY MALO! Aviod. Piscina no funciona”
Reviews.Author: ukfeed
Reviews.Content: Waited over 1 hour for shuttle bus. Staff did not care. Swimming pool is CLOSED. You will be charged for Internet even though it's stated free. Walls paper thin

Reviews.Title: “Agood place / location for visiting Madrid ar reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: BimLondon
Reviews.Content: Located not far from the airport (10 mins by hotel shuttlebus) yet near to the Madrid metro (Line 5 Canillejas) - the metro system is a bargain for travellers (tourist ticket) and central Madrid is only twenty five minutes away. The hotel is basic but clean and quiet (no aircraft noise) and in an OK district. ten minutes walk to metro and a great little bar where the Spaniards hang out past midnight just by the station. We had a great visit to this lovely city and it didn't cost the earth.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but a long way out”
Reviews.Author: Kittybat12
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal at this hotel through Travelzoo (3 nights over bank holiday for £100) so took a chance and was pleasantly surprised. It is in a very quiet area of Madrid near the airport but no aircraft noise. Hotel offers a free shuttle service to /from airport but we had a cab there as our flight was delayed and we didn't want to wait for the bus. The cab fare was just over 16 euro. We had a superior "bungalow" which overlooked an immaculate and shaded lawn leading on to a really nice pool area. Not in fact a bungalow but in a building reminiscent of a holiday camp chalet from the 1950s, very quaint and slightly shabby chic. However inside was very spacious, cool and immaculate with 2 big beds, sofa, chair occasional tables and a decent bathroom. Aircon worked well but was a bit noisey. Nice little balcony with rather tatty iron table and 2 chairs, but lovely for a late drink. It is about a 10 minute walk to the nearest Metro and then about 20 mins into the centre of Madrid. Tourist travel tickets are good value at about 4 euro a day and can be used on buses and Metro. Food was expensive - we had a steak sandwich, pizza and 4 beers and the bill was 65 euros - this was from the bar menu. There is a fine dining restaurant which we did not eat in but the prices were considerably higher than the bar menu. There were several local dining options close to the Metro which looked very good value and only a 10 minute walk away. There were also a couple of supermarkets here which sold basic provisions and a 1l bottleof waterwas 90c compared to 2.5 euro for 500ml from hotel. However this is a 4 star hotel and it is in Madrid so we expected high prices and overall the hotel is good value if you don't mind the metro trip into the city centre, and the pool area is truly an oasis in the searing August temperatures

Reviews.Title: “ok if you have early flight”
Reviews.Author: mistercrabs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel before an early am flight from Madrid. Rooms were okay, we needed two for a family of four. Rooms we stayed in were bungalow style. A bit dated, could have been cleaner. Saw hair on floor in bathroom and shower curtain was in need of replacement. Nice pool and outside area though! Received our wake up call promptly. Had to wait for shuttle in am - told to be in lobby at 4:30 but when arrived told us it was already full - even though we were added to list night before. Attendant at desk should have known shuttle would have been full. However, waited only about 15 minutes or so though for shuttle to return for us. Quick and easy ride to airport from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value 3 star airport hotel for one night stopovers. Beware "courtesy" breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: I-love-world-travel
Reviews.Content: While the hotel classifies itself as a 4 star hotel, the hotel itself is more 2.5 to 3 stars. The rooms have external entrances and are small and quite basic. The rooms remind me of the Motel 6 sort but with just a few more complimentary bathroom amenities. The air conditioning is also never quite effective enough to cool the room. Lobby needs updating and is quite smoking. That said, for a rate of $67 booked on travelocity, the hotel is a good deal. The free shuttle provides regular transfers to the airport. Terminals 1 & 2 are 5 kms away. Terminal 4 is 10 km away. The restaurant is more up to the 4 star standard to hotel claims. Starters are 9-14 euros. Entrees run 15 to 26 euros. Breakfast is excellent and includes a broad selection of breads, fruit, and hot and cold dishes. The pool was a nice bonus although it is only open 11am to 8pm. Unfortunately, no free internet. 6 euros for one hour or 12 euros for 24 hours. WARNING: Travelocity listed that the hotel offered a 'courtesy breakfast' and this was one of the deciding factors in choosing this hotel. However, upon checkout we were told that our room rate did not include breakfast which was an additional 13 euros per person. It was only after speaking with the manager and showing him that breakfast was listed as free on the website that he removed the charge.

Reviews.Title: “Good for one night on way to or from Airport! Check your Bill.”
Reviews.Author: Naim00
Reviews.Content: The location is convenient in case you have a night to kill on way in or out of airport and that's about it. Service is not very friendly. Rooms are apparently separated into the bungalows overlooking the grass and some rooms in an old dorm like building 5 minute walk from reception. This hotel just does not feel clean.. an impression maybe, but sheets and towels are not pristine. Rooms are decent and the bathroom looks old. They provide some OK shampoo and soap. Internet service is 12 euros and it was very erratic. I kept losing the connections and finally called the reception to complain. 5 minutes later the IT guy calls and states that he rebooted the system. It functioned OK for about 1 hour then again I was losing the connection. To my surprise, they charged me 12 euros plus 1 euro for the PHONE CALL!!!!! They have a parking, they say online that it is paying. I was able to find a spot on the street. It appeared safe since it's a very residential area. The Bkfast is expensive and not impressive at all.. AVOID IT if you can. They charge otherwise 2.5e for the Nespresso cup.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you have an early morning flight”
Reviews.Author: JiLy77
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the combination of price and needing a shuttle to the airport at 4:30 am – the shuttle worked well. The area immediately around the hotel is in a quiet residential area. The hotel is spread out, almost like a small town American motel from the mid-1950s, except it has 2 stories. Appears to be an older hotel, with some newer parts. Some of the outside of the hotel looked somewhat worn, but the inside of our room was nice and large enough. The hotel grounds have a grassy courtyard between the rows of rooms, and the pool would be considered one of the larger hotel/motel pools in the US. The staff was helpful, with adequate English. There was no mattress cover on our bed.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice near airport for 1 night transfer”
Reviews.Author: dcc7
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very nice option for a 1 night transfer. Close to airport, fairly close to metro station. The shuttle service from the airport was frustratingly slow -- would be better to find other way to hotel. Shuttle back to airport was fine, even very early in the AM. Breakfast options not available for early flight.

Reviews.Title: “Thought we would be killed by speeding shuttle driver, horrible food.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa898
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel due to a flight layover so we found this hotel online. The draw was the price and the shuttle service to and from the hotel. I called the hotel when we landed and the receptionist barely knew English, she became frustrated and so did I trying to communicate. The shuttle arrived and the driver drove like an Indy 500 racer, he had to be going at least 90+ miles per hour. We finally arrived and checked in. My partner was hungry but the kitchen was closed but the hotel staff offered to make something anyway...they brought us the food, we went to our room to eat....it was awful, a steak sandwich, not even edible, or chewable....then a pizza with jalapenos all over, too hot to consume and a sandwich, this is what we shared...for this they charged nearly $40.00 US, what a ripoff. The cook staff must have been mad to give us that offal. Then we were directed to our rooms, we didn't realize the hotel was across from the rooms they directed us to. We came back to the hotel, mind you it is dark, we are tired and dragging luggage with us. The hotel staff never once offered to escort us to our room, the manager directed us through the pool area and we finally located the hotel, ridiculous. The rooms were run down looking with two twin beds very far apart. The bed springs could be felt but surprisingly they were comfortable, I slept well. The bathroom was very nice, modern and clean with a nice kit of toothbrush, shower gel, soap and a sewing kit. We checked out, not buffet breakfast. The shuttle came and the morning driver was much more courteous, drove safely and helpful. Another thing there was a long list of warnings for hotel guests on the hotel room table which kind of scared me, I put the chair against the door after reading it.

Reviews.Title: “Not All It Seems”
Reviews.Author: BoardmanMijas_Spain
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the first time as a base for an exhibiton I was visiting. A draw for me was the free shuttle bus door to door to IFEMA, the exhibition venue, but this bus has only 12 seats and I was in a queue of 18! It would have been a 30 to 40 minute wait in the cold for the bus to come around again, by which time I can't imagine how many other people would have appeared. The rooms are mainly chalet type and although comfortable, the walls are paper thin and you can hear people in the rooms around you taking their showers. Speaking of which, my shower holster was broken, something I didn't discover until the morning when it was too late to fix it. They did fix the TV though when I reported it faulty soon after arriving. One tip if you do go.......make sure you know exactly where your room is, as they are all accessed by going outside from Reception and the signage is terrible. It took me 10 minutes to find my room.

Reviews.Title: “Just a quick overnight stay-probably the extent of which I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: kozmam
Reviews.Content: We started with the hotel shuttle picking us up from the airport. The driver let my husband load all the suitcases and did not offer to help-therefore he did not receive a tip from us. The airport is classified as an "airport hotel", but don't compare it to the ones here in the US as it is not tailored to the business person.Use the shuttle because it is a decent distance from the airport. The front desk worker came out and greeted us when we arrived and unloaded the suitcases. It was a quick check-in. If you want to use either wireless internet or their computer, it will cost a few euros. The room was in the larger building in the back and was good sized, yet a little outdated. Their goal appears to be an "old world" feel, but it really is just older things. You could probably only do one night in the bed because we could feel the springs and there was no boxspring, so it was very low to the floor. Bathroom was great with a very large shower. Elevators-like most in Europe-are very small and will only fit 1 person and a suitcase. Check-out was quick and easy. There is a beautiful pool, patio and restaurant but they were all closed due to it being off-season and also late at night. We only stayed because of an overnight layover and I would only recommend it for that purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Value Hotel near Madrid Airport with Free Shuttle”
Reviews.Author: Marvelous_Travelers
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to save some money than this hotel is perfect. It is about 6km from the Madrid Airport Terminal 1. When we landed I called the hotel and the spoke perfect English (once they realized I was American and my Spanish was not that great). The shuttle arrived about 20 minutes past 9AM and we were taken to the hotel. They did not have our room ready but we're willing to hold our bags. The lobby was nicely appointed and had a cocktail bar and nice seating arrangements. The hotel is not aethestically all that pleasing, but it is clean and gets the job done. It was about a 17Euro cab ride to the city center so keep that in mind if you weighing the cost of this hotel vs. one in the city. The rooms were nice enough and had a large bathroom and shower. Again, this is a value hotel, but we were pleasantly suprised with the accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel for a stopover in MAD, bit far from subway...”
Reviews.Author: Cristina_1981
Reviews.Content: We spent only 2 nights, we had the departure very early in the morning so the shuttle was usefull, be aware you need to inform reception one night before. Positives: - good shuttle service - needs 10 min to come pick u up from MAD airport, bus shuttle station in terminal 4 is just outside EXIT, on the left, on the wall you can find the tel.no of all hotels in the area that have shuttle. - reception staff ok, but not too much English; - rooms clean, spacious, bathroom clean, products in the bathroom like shampoo, toothbrush and paste, etc. - clean pool but small; - direct line via subway (metro) to the city center; - 10 min walk to Il Corte Ingles Spanish mall (incl supermarket) - breakfast very good - you can find everything - iagurt, cheese, vegetables, ham, croissaints... etc Negaives: - too far from subway - you need to cross a bridge, and takes about 15-20 min; - noisy room - hotel situated in rezidential area but there is a school just behind the hotel, so starting 7 am pupils come and talk near your window... not very cool! The small houses on the website are not the one you will be staying, the hotel is in the back, I guess they sell also those small houses but we did not see anyone there, only in the building that we were on (that looks like an office building from outside). I would go back if I would need just a stopover for a flight, otherwize is far from city, about 30 min by subway. regards, Cristina

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable room but not UK 4*”
Reviews.Author: mikel001
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel following comments made on this site, and thanks to everyone who commented we were not disappointed. Our party was two adults, two teenagers 16,14 and a 7 year old. The rooms were slightly smaller than we expected as 4* but even with 3 single beds in one room there was enough space so no real complaints. The reason for saying it was not 4* is because of the peeling wall paper and dirt marks on the walls. the rooms and bathrooms were kept very clean daily by non english speaking staff, and contrary to comments on this site the reception staff were helpful and courteous especially as only my 14 year old daughter could speak basic Spanish. One real complaint, as non smokers and one member with asthma, was the lingering smell of cigarettes in reception and bar because of the smoking area close by which appeared to be unventilated.We could not really use the patio as the aquafans blew smoke in our direction also.. The airport shuttle worked well 15min wait on the way there and no rfeal wait on the way home. I thought the pool was excellent as it was a reasonable size and deep enough to dive in, the pool had a lifeguard in attendance and opens at 11:00 which stopped anyone taking the few sunbeds then going to breakfast, I would agree the pool could do with at least 5 more beds but there is a nice garden area to sit in the shade if needed. Buffet breakfast was adequate, pleanty of choice, didn't try dinner too expensive for a family of 5. The metro (7.40E for a 10 single trip ticket) was indeed a good 20min walk and in hot weather following a day in the centre it was hike.. We found the bar two blocks up the road opposite and to the right where we had a reasonable meal on the Saturday, roast chicken cooked specially for us on request but were dissapointed to find that these were not available every other time we walked past (they only do them at the weekend). Supermaket was again in this direction 10mins walk, also in this area were a number of restaurants, we mostly ate in VIPS, where the food was good quality and value for money compared to other restauantes we tried(coke was 2.70E for 50cl where others were 2.70E for 20cl !). All in all a good quiet hotel in reasonable travelling distance from the centre of Madrid with an excellent pool to relax in following a hot sweaty day in the centre of Madrid. (Shame the exchange rate made the whole trip very expensive)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not enough sunbeds”
Reviews.Author: JMH123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Osuna for three nights in August 2009. Excellent airport shuttle service, nice comfortable room, staff are very efficient and reasonably friendly. Drink prices are not too expensive for a 4* hotel. Very nice pool area and gardens but only some 15 sunbeds available, not enough, only managed to get one on first day. Also hotel is a good kilometer away from nearest metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, well equipped for the bargain price!”
Reviews.Author: theligerandligress
Reviews.Content: We picked Osuna first of all because of the free shuttle service to the airport and also the pool. It's located in a quiet residential area where the surrounding houses are large and beautiful. The welcome on arrival was very warm and friendly. We were travelling with our one year old daughter and like everywhere else we've been in Madrid they treated her like a little princess. The room was very small - it was a triple ( i think they used a double and just put in a single bed - but it was still 2 double beds and a single for 69 euros) but there were lots of the small luxuries like you'd expect from a 4* hotel, complimentary toiletries etc.. There's a great pool which is open from 11-8pm with shallow end perfect for children. There's also a small play park within the complex ideal for older children. The hotel is in a quadrangle shape -- with self catering apartments down 2 sides the hotel rooms round 1 other and the final side made up of the reception, bar and terrace and restaurant. In the middle is pool, green space & park. The terrace is kept fresh by atomisers and you can get tapas in the evening and it's table service. We had a quite a few drinks and it wasn't expensive, we then went into the restaurant where the food was fabulous, infact the best Filet Mignon we'd ever tasted. The restaurant prices were quite expensive but it's a hotel and you expect to pay more. Service was excellent. If you don't want to eat in the retaurant there's a great bar/café near by. Directly opposite the hotel is a road you walk straight up, past the houses and cross over the road still walking straight, past the block of flats with pool and you will see a santander bank (useful cashpoint) and next to it a big bar, great for breakfast and lunch. There is a small bar previous street down and to the right, with a shop and hairdressers next to it, please don't go there, it's very local! (We're native spanish speakers and we were made to feel like very unwelcome strangers!). Hotel Osuna is a tube ride away into the centre of madrid (about 20mins or so) and you have to cross via a footbridge over a very busy large road not the easiest to get to so perhaps more ideal if you want to use it as a stopping place before you fly home. The shuttle service was good and it only takes about 10mins to the airport. A pleasant stay, one we'd probably do again.

Reviews.Title: “Urgent Staff Training Need. How To Treat Customers”
Reviews.Author: FRAZZLE0
Reviews.Content: Staff very rude and unhelpful in general. There was one exception, I think he was an Australian gentlman and nothing was too much trouble. Rooms clean and tidy, the pool area is quite nice. Metro was about 15 mins walk from hotel then very easy to get into centre of Madrid (about 15-20 mins on metro ) Was amazed when we were having a quiet drink at 11.30 - 12 midnight so not late when the lights were shut off and place shut down, very rude. The Spanish seemed to be treated much better than the British I think this Hotel could be very nice if staff were more friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fair choice”
Reviews.Author: Carefulchooser
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Osuna Hotel in June 2009. The hotel is located in a residential area and we liked that there is a hypermarket within 10 minutes of walking. However, to visit the historic areas you definitely need to drive. The hotel has a pool, which was great after days of walking through museums and parks. Parking is free for the surface spots, but the underground ones are not free. Unfortunately, the surface spots are rather small and frequently one car takes two spots. The room we were in required some maintenance, as something vibrated in the air conditioning area, even when it was turned off... The most disappointing thing was the Internet access, which cost 3 Euros for 9 minutes... I ended up having to pay 9 Euros to book my next hotels. Breakfast was 13 Euros, so we went to a nearby cafe (which we have noticed by accident - again this is a residential area, so not thay many cafes around). There's also a small playground not far from the pool, which was a bonus for our little one. Not a bad stay overall, but wished it were within walking distance from downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: jeremymmason
Reviews.Content: After some very scathing reviews, I was concerned to stay here, but we needed a good airport hotel in between flights, and Hotel Osuna did not disappoint. We stayed in a room in the large building in the back, and while the furniture was a bit institutional, the room was very large and comfortable and it had a great shower. The pool was very clean and well maintained (with a lifeguard), and the kids loved the playground. The restaurant is a touch expensive, but all of the food was good for a hotel. The staff was slightly ambivalent, but no more than many of the places I have stayed in Spain. We had no problems at all with the hotel shuttle, although we did have to wait 30 minutes for it to arrive at the airport after we called for it. All in all, we were very happy with the hotel and I would absolutely stay there again if I needed to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean accommodation - service could be better”
Reviews.Author: Herman_SouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: A great stay at Osuna was spoilt somewhat by the unwillingness of the staff at reception to assist me with finding my lost luggage. The helpful taxidriver of the hotel came to our rescue the next day to deliver the luggage to us personally at the airport. Otherwise, this place is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok, but not child-proof”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamBrigitte
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel beacuse it has a swimming pool, a garden and a playground: Great for little kids. What we didn't realize is that it is not fit for little kids: There is no babycot and no babypool. And the opening times are not childfriendly: The pool does not open until 11 am and the restaurant does not open until 8:30 pm. Unfortuantely, this kind of information is not available on their website and they don't respond to e-mails that were sent in English (don't know about Spanish e-mails). For the rest, it is a pleasant and clean hotel with friendly staff - for Spanish standards.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Pool and Bungalow”
Reviews.Author: GeznMartin
Reviews.Content: The Hotel area was very nice and the Bungalows are very well furnished although the air conditioning was not up to much, one night we returned and it was actually warmer in the room than it was outside . The pool was great and the attendent was very friendly , they give you clean towels to use around the pool so you do not use the towels from the room . Breakfast was very nice and the hotel reception staff were very friendly and helpful and we were picked up from the airport and taken back by the hotel courtesy bus . You have to ring once you land and tell them what terminal you are at . The bus runs 24 hours which was good . The staff in the bar area were a different story !! . One night i was actually ignored and after 10 minutes i gave up and went . After this we decided that we did noy want to spend any more money there than was necessary . There is a big supermarket 10 mins away , turn right out of the hotel , 2nd left 1st right and follow the road round .There are lots of bars etc in the surrounding area . it is worth a walk to see what else is on offer in the surrounding area .

Reviews.Title: “we love it”
Reviews.Author: zekka
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative comments on here you would expect to get a substandard room at Osuna we visited hotel on a short braik and paid a very reasonably €118 for a 2 x double bads standard room. Yes its true that the public areas are absolutely WOW and also the poolside lido and bar. Bottom line for what I paid, the standard room was a bargain and very comfortable too. The hotel was very clean and service extremely friendly without being over the top.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Zfinks
Reviews.Content: We went to Osuna, with our three year old girl, and we had a wonderful time there. The staff was very helpful and english speaking, and we had a bungalow apartement near the pool as I requested. The pool was very lovely and surrounded by a palmtree garden with exotic flowers. The hotel had become a four star hotel, but we only paid the three star rate. We also tried the restaurant, as it was possible to eat outside by the pool in beutiful surroundings. The restaurant was a little expensive, but the food was very nice. We had no trouble getting around. We had a ten minute walk to the metro station, who took us all over town in a few minutes !

Reviews.Title: “Mean, angry staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: ebucceri
Reviews.Content: Never in my life have I encountered front desk staff as rude as at the Hotel Osuna. The night clerk literally threw the key down on the counter and refused to tell us where the room was! He actually just had us follow some other guest whose room was nearby (the hotel is set up resort-style with little bunglows, so it was not easy to find a room as in a big block-style hotel). When I asked about the shuttle service to the airport, he got even angrier, huffed and puffed and uttered some profanities! I was so shocked by the rude front desk staff that I honestly thought it was a joke - like I was on Candid Camera or something. I was actually shaken over this guy's anger! I thought he was going to jump over the counter and strangle me! That said, the hotel itself is OK for the price - 60 Euros/night for a double. It has a nice pool and the room was pretty decent, except for a dead spider in the bed. Still I was scared of the mean, angry night clerk so the fear really wasn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “trying to be a 4 star...”
Reviews.Author: YALS
Reviews.Content: this hotel is outside of the city and doenst seem to be accessable by public transportation... when we arrived the room was so HOT we couldnt believe it, I wouldnt be surprised if it was close to 45 Celsius degrees in there..it was insane. We had to open the window but it was so hot furniture continued to radiate heat after we shut the windows so we had to open them again during the night... The rooms are not sound proof at all, We had two babies with us and the other guests were hanging out in the hallway talking and drinking and it was as if they were in our room with us, it was only 9pm and they really werent being unreasonably loud, it was just that the walls were so thin. The rooms were decorated nicely but the mattresses were uncomfortable. no cable tv, just local channels, The breakfast was really good however and the pool looked nice although it was too cold to swim. There is one shuttle which brings people to the airport so if you miss it you have to wait about 40 minutes for the next one..something they dont tell you!!

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Tenn5Traveler
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation at the Osuna Hotel in Madrid Spain. The hotel was rated 2 1/2 stars. The hotel shouldn't even be a 1 star. This hotel was worse than truck stop motels I've had the misfortune of staying in. There was no air conditioning. The bed was basically a box spring on a plywood platform if it was supposed to be a mattress - it was the worst one I've ever seen. The walls were paper thin and every little noise from adjoining rooms and above and below could be heard. There was an item in the description that said "sound proofed walls!" - not!! The lobby was laughable - basically here was none. I knew I was in trouble when I saw a sign that said they we're "renovating" and sorry for the inconvience. I didn't see any signs of "work" in progress. This is code for everything is broken and doesn't work. The neighboorhood didn't seem very safe either. I feel very upset and taken advantage of by this deal. Experiences like this are why I almost always take cruises - because you can't trust internet hotel ratings or for that matter almost any rating system of hotels. A 2 1/2 star hotel should be of a Baymont level of hotel - this wasn't. The only thing I can say good is that the bathroom seemed to be clean - the rest of the room was pretty ratty and threadbare. A most unhappy customer,

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Be My First Choice”
Reviews.Author: happyjackman
Reviews.Content: We would always pick a hotel at random once arriving at our destination train station in Spain. In Seville and other cities, we always tried to stay in the $150-200/night price range and our hotels were lovely. However, this was the only exception. Our only requirement when booking was that it was near the airport. And, that it is, with a free shuttle to and from the airport that is quite convenient. However, that's the only upside. The hotel's neighborhood seems nice and safe, but is very out of town. It is nearly a 45-minute subway ride to the major plazas and sights. The hotel lobby was under much-needed construction, which made everything look even worse (but, hopefully it will improve the hotel because it is VERY run down). It was nearly impossible to get an internet access signal despite paying for the service. There is not even a typical hotel information book in the room (I had to just press numbers on the phone to figure out how to dial the front desk, dial out of the hotel, and had to ask someone what the hotel phone number was because it wasn't listed anywhere). Finally, the rooms were clean enough, but again were in need of improvement. The hardwood floors are warped and the whole thing is in need of updating. If you're just looking for a quick stay near the airport, it's fine. But, if you want anything more, there are much nicer hotels for the cost throughout the city.

Reviews.Title: “The most horrible stay”
Reviews.Author: Olena-TRIP
Reviews.Content: This was one the worst experience ever! Starting with the very uncomfortable location (far away from any communications) and finishing with the fact that we were robbed in our room during the last night of our stay. The staff is very rude, they even could not tell us how to get to the city centre, we have to aks people in the street. When you approached the reception desk they would start telephone conversation and you had to wait for ages. The last straw was when we came back last night and the window was open and we relised that we lacked our things, we were robbed a camara and a mobile and various chargers. The reception was indifferent about the case and said that it was us who were guilty. So, that was the most horrible and unjust treatment that people staying in a 4star hotel may receive. We never recuperate anything and the hotel's presentation about the robbery was full of lies. You'd better save your money and nerves and go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, good for airport access”
Reviews.Author: Cliffu
Reviews.Content: Much better than the reviews here indicate. Nice pool for Madrid. We have 3 children and they loved it. Too far from the city for us, but it worked great on the night before our flight. Good staff, decent rooms, easy airport access. Very inexpensive on their website at 47 Euro/night.

Reviews.Title: “So rude!!”
Reviews.Author: bluetillew
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with about a dozen other guys on a mate's stag do for the weekend and the hotel itself is actually OK. The rooms were pretty good and clean, the location isn't bad (about 12-15 EUR for cab into city centre or a metro but that seemed to take ages so didn't bother after trying it once), the pool OK (no sun loungers though) and the bar and food nice. Maybe it was because we were an all male party and I might be bias but we were very well behaved! We didn't make much noise, were polite and didn't cause them any problems, at least that's my view. But the problem is the male staff (the women were fine) are extremely rude and miserable not really what you really want on your holiday! There was certainly a language barrier which probably made the situation worse. I won't go into the details about some of the rudeness we had to put up with but think twice if you are English and are thinking of staying here.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: meatfleece
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a last minute thing and after reading a previous review I became a little concerned. No need, it was extremely charming. The area around the hotel was a little worrying but I suppose it was in a city. The restaurant was of an excellent standard and the room also was very nice and clean with a marble tiled bathroom. My only disappointment was that there was no tea or coffee facilities but snacks and drinks were very reasonable at the bar area. The pool was well maintained and pleasant. It took us 20 minutes to get to the centre of Madrid using the nearby metro. The staff were polite but we had a bit of a problem trying to understand the menu as it was only written in Spanish, they did their best to translate but it was pot luck really. We would go again, a very pleasant few days.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel with a friendly staff, large, clean rooms and reasonably priced. The hotel is very close to the Madrid Airport and not too far from downtown (though traffic was a problem in the afternoon/early evening). It was also undergoing an expansion and our room was practically brand new. I was only here one night and did not try the restaurant, but from my experience I would definetely recommend this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Osuna Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Luis De La Mata 18, 28042 Madrid, Spain
